questions.question: 1. The main goal of the Nussinov algorithm is to:

answers.a: To predict the tertiary structure of RNA
answers.b: To find the RNA sequence that codes for a specific protein
answers.c: To maximize the number of base pairs in an RNA secondary structure
answers.d: To determine the DNA sequence complementary to RNA

questions.question: 2. The purpose of the traceback step in the Nussinov algorithm is

answers.a: To determine the thermodynamic stability of RNA
answers.b: To reconstruct the predicted RNA secondary structure
answers.c: To generate a random sequence of RNA bases
answers.d: To optimize the length of RNA sequences

questions.question: 3. The time complexity of the Nussinov algorithm is:
4. The difference between Nussinov algorithm from Zukerâ€™s algorithm is:

answers.a: Nussinov maximizes base pair formation, while Zuker minimizes free energy
answers.b: Nussinov predicts tertiary structure, while Zuker predicts secondary structure
answers.c: Nussinov does not use dynamic programming, while Zuker does
answers.d: Nussinov is used only for DNA folding, while Zuker is used for RNA

questions.question: 5. Given the RNA sequence G C A U C G, how many base pairs will be formed using the Nussinov algorithm?
